alert.note: Alert for Sonoma (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 10 at 6:28PM PST until January 11 at 2:00PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Northern Sonoma County including Healdsburg and Cloverdale. * WHEN...Until 930 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 628 PM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.3 and 0.6 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.4 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Windsor, Healdsburg, Cloverdale, Forestville, Guerneville and Monte Rio. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
